result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd L. Stickler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan commencing on or before April 5, 2016. Defendant advised of $15 payment plan fee.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd L. Stickler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd L. Stickler in court with attorney Todd W. Bennett.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Bennett agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Bennett makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in April

Final pre-trial at 01-08-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Todd W. Bennett in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Bennett states that his client was supposed to get some information for the DA's office which he has but does not have the information back yet.
Atty Bennett enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Petition for Leavce to File Additional Motions

Attorney Todd W. Bennett in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Bennett files an authorization with the court.
Atty Hendee states that he has not had a pre-trial with Atty Bennett yet.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Return date scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Todd L. Stickler in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he met with the defendant at a pre-trial conference and an offer was provided.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant; he would like to get an Attorney.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on March 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No violent or abusive contact with Jeffrey Neubauer

Defendant Todd L. Stickler in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*No violent or abusive contact with Jeffrey Neubauer

Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
  Return date scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
